        The heap buffer overflow happens at<span class="line"><!---->The heap buffer overflow happens at<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2018;drc=43c99a312a3fa5736d6eca4db63908c08ddafff3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2018;drc=43c99a312a3fa5736d6eca4db63908c08ddafff3"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2018;drc=43c99a312a3fa5736d6eca4db63908c08ddafff3<!----></a><br><br>    contents_data_.insert(contents_data_.begin() + to_position,<span class="line"><!---->    contents_data_.insert(contents_data_.begin() + to_position,<!----></span><br>                            std::move(moved_data));<span class="line"><!---->                            std::move(moved_data));<!----></span><br><br>as there is no check if `to_position` is out of bounds of `contents_data_`.<span class="line"><!---->as there is no check if `to_position` is out of bounds of `contents_data_`.<!----></span><br><br><br>---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br><br>The fix would be to constrain `to_index` in `TabStripModel::MoveGroupTo`<span class="line"><!---->The fix would be to constrain `to_index` in `TabStripModel::MoveGroupTo`<!----></span><br>and add a CHECK in `TabStripModel::MoveWebContentsAtImpl` to crash in case it's called with an invalid index.<span class="line"><!---->and add a CHECK in `TabStripModel::MoveWebContentsAtImpl` to crash in case it's called with an invalid index.<!----></span><br><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=671;drc=0e45c020c43b1a9f6d2870ff7f92b30a2f03a458<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=671;drc=0e45c020c43b1a9f6d2870ff7f92b30a2f03a458"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=671;drc=0e45c020c43b1a9f6d2870ff7f92b30a2f03a458<!----></a><br><br>to_index = ConstrainMoveIndex(to_index, false);<span class="line"><!---->to_index = ConstrainMoveIndex(to_index, false);<!----></span><br><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2013;drc=43c99a312a3fa5736d6eca4db63908c08ddafff3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2013;drc=43c99a312a3fa5736d6eca4db63908c08ddafff3"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2013;drc=43c99a312a3fa5736d6eca4db63908c08ddafff3<!----></a><br><br>CHECK_LT(index, static_cast<int>(contents_data_.size()));<span class="line"><!---->CHECK_LT(index, static_cast&lt;int&gt;(contents_data_.size()));<!----></span><br>CHECK_LT(to_position, static_cast<int>(contents_data_.size()));<span class="line"><!---->CHECK_LT(to_position, static_cast&lt;int&gt;(contents_data_.size()));<!----></span><br>// or<span class="line"><!---->// or<!----></span><br>CHECK(ContainsIndex(index));<span class="line"><!---->CHECK(ContainsIndex(index));<!----></span><br>CHECK(ContainsIndex(to_position));<span         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         Not requesting merge to dev (M99) because latest trunk commit (958882) appears to be prior to dev branch point (961656).         Hello, Thomas. Thanks for reaching out about this and following up with an email request. Apologies for the delay as we worked through our bug reward decisions. <span class="line"><!---->Hello, Thomas. Thanks for reaching out about this and following up with an email request. Apologies for the delay as we worked through our bug reward decisions. <!----></span><br>The other issue you linked as an example (<span class="line"><!---->The other issue you linked as an example (<!----></span>issue 1239057<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1239057" title="Security: UaF in TabStripModel::MoveWebContentsAtImpl"><!---->issue 1239057<!----></a>) was discovered and reported mid last year, and was relatively early on during very recent trend of reports away from issues triggered by remote content to issues that were strongly or solely dependent on user interaction. While these issues are important as well and can be exploited by a convincing attacker and a convinced user, they aren't as strongly exploitable and impactful as the bug reports that demonstrate exploitability with report content or the most limited. We have started to adjust reward amounts accordingly and have updated our VRP reward rules and guidelines [1] recently to reflect that. <span class="line"><!---->) was discovered and reported mid last year, and was relatively early on during very recent trend of reports away from issues triggered by remote content to issues that were strongly or solely dependent on user interaction. While these issues are important as well and can be exploited by a convincing attacker and a convinced user, they aren't as strongly exploitable and impactful as the bug reports that demonstrate exploitability with report content or the most limited. We have started to adjust reward amounts accordingly and have updated our VRP reward rules and guidelines [1] recently to reflect that. <!----></span><br><br>Based on this and while we appreciate your efforts and reporting this issue to us, the VRP Panel has decided that the original reward amount is sufficient for this report. <span class="line"><!---->Based on this and while we appreciate your efforts and reporting this issue to us, the VRP Panel has decided that the original reward amount is sufficient for this report. <!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/5745167867576320<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/5745167867576320"><!---->https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/5745167867576320<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>With the Touch UI layout, dragging a tab group after a tab that has just closed causes a heap-buffer-overflow.<span class="line"><!---->With the Touch UI layout, dragging a tab group after a tab that has just closed causes a heap-buffer-overflow.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 99.0.4774.0<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 99.0.4774.0<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. chrome --top-chrome-touch-ui=enabled<span class="line"><!---->1. chrome --top-chrome-touch-ui=enabled<!----></span><br>2. Add the NTP to a new tab group<span class="line"><!---->2. Add the NTP to a new tab group<!----></span><br>3. Open poc.html in a new tab<span class="line"><!---->3. Open poc.html in a new tab<!----></span><br>4. Drag the tab group to the right of poc.html<span class="line"><!---->4. Drag the tab group to the right of poc.html<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State:<span class="line"><!---->Crash 0x00bc837fdea8<!----></span><br>READ of size 8 at 0x127bf1b11f18 thread T0<span class="line"><!---->READ of size 8 at 0x127bf1b11f18 thread T0<!----></span><br>==15532==WARNING: Failed to use and fa fa fa fa fa fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fa<span class="line"><!---->  0x04bf6f6e2400: fd fd fd fa fa fa fa fa fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fa<!----></span><br>  0x04bf6f6e2410: fa fa fa fa fd fd fd fd fd fd fd fd         <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Dec 24, 2021, 11:01 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        The heap buffer overflow happens at<span class="line"><!---->The heap buffer overflow happens at<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2018;drc=43c99a312a3fa5736d6eca4db63908c08ddafff3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2018;drc=43c99a312a3fa5736d6eca4db63908c08ddafff3"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2018;drc=43c99a312a3fa5736d6eca4db63908c08ddafff3<!----></a><br><br>    contents_data_.insert(contents_data_.begin() + to_position,<span class="line"><!---->    contents_data_.insert(contents_data_.begin() + to_position,<!----></span><br>                            std::move(moved_data));<span class="line"><!---->                            std::move(moved_data));<!----></span><br><br>as there is no check if `to_position` is out of bounds of `contents_data_`.<span class="line"><!---->as there is no check if `to_position` is out of bounds of `contents_data_`.<!----></span><br><br><br>---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br><br>The fix would be to constrain `to_index` in `TabStripModel::MoveGroupTo`<span class="line"><!---->The fix would be to constrain `to_index` in `TabStripModel::MoveGroupTo`<!----></span><br>and add a CHECK in `TabStripModel::MoveWebContentsAtImpl` to crash in case it's called with an invalid index.<span class="line"><!---->and add a CHECK in `TabStripModel::MoveWebContentsAtImpl` to crash in case it's called with an invalid index.<!----></span><br><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=671;drc=0e45c020c43b1a9f6d2870ff7f92b30a2f03a458<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=671;drc=0e45c020c43b1a9f6d2870ff7f92b30a2f03a458"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=671;drc=0e45c020c43b1a9f6d2870ff7f92b30a2f03a458<!----></a><br><br>to_index = ConstrainMoveIndex(to_index, false);<span class="line"><!---->to_index = ConstrainMoveIndex(to_index, false);<!----></span><br><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2013;drc=43c99a312a3fa5736d6eca4db63908c08ddafff3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2013;drc=43c99a312a3fa5736d6eca4db63908c08ddafff3"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2013;drc=43c99a312a3fa5736d6eca4db63908c08ddafff3<!----></a><br><br>CHECK_LT(index, static_cast<int>(contents_data_.size()));<span class="line"><!---->CHECK_LT(index, static_cast&lt;int&gt;(contents_data_.size()));<!----></span><br>CHECK_LT(to_position, static_cast<int>(contents_data_.size()));<span class="line"><!---->CHECK_LT(to_position, static_cast&lt;int&gt;(contents_data_.size()));<!----></span><br>// or<span class="line"><!---->// or<!----></span><br>CHECK(ContainsIndex(index));<span class="line"><!---->CHECK(ContainsIndex(index));<!----></span><br>CHECK(ContainsIndex(to_position));<span         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hello, Thomas. Thanks for reaching out about this and following up with an email request. Apologies for the delay as we worked through our bug reward decisions. <span class="line"><!---->Hello, Thomas. Thanks for reaching out about this and following up with an email request. Apologies for the delay as we worked through our bug reward decisions. <!----></span><br>The other issue you linked as an example (<span class="line"><!---->The other issue you linked as an example (<!----></span>issue 1239057<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1239057" title="Security: UaF in TabStripModel::MoveWebContentsAtImpl"><!---->issue 1239057<!----></a>) was discovered and reported mid last year, and was relatively early on during very recent trend of reports away from issues triggered by remote content to issues that were strongly or solely dependent on user interaction. While these issues are important as well and can be exploited by a convincing attacker and a convinced user, they aren't as strongly exploitable and impactful as the bug reports that demonstrate exploitability with report content or the most limited. We have started to adjust reward amounts accordingly and have updated our VRP reward rules and guidelines [1] recently to reflect that. <span class="line"><!---->) was discovered and reported mid last year, and was relatively early on during very recent trend of reports away from issues triggered by remote content to issues that were strongly or solely dependent on user interaction. While these issues are important as well and can be exploited by a convincing attacker and a convinced user, they aren't as strongly exploitable and impactful as the bug reports that demonstrate exploitability with report content or the most limited. We have started to adjust reward amounts accordingly and have updated our VRP reward rules and guidelines [1] recently to reflect that. <!----></span><br><br>Based on this and while we appreciate your efforts and reporting this issue to us, the VRP Panel has decided that the original reward amount is sufficient for this report. <span class="line"><!---->Based on this and while we appreciate your efforts and reporting this issue to us, the VRP Panel has decided that the original reward amount is sufficient for this report. <!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/5745167867576320<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/5745167867576320"><!---->https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/5745167867576320<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The heap buffer overflow happens at<span class="line"><!---->The heap buffer overflow happens at<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2018;drc=43c99a312a3fa5736d6eca4db63908c08ddafff3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2018;drc=43c99a312a3fa5736d6eca4db63908c08ddafff3"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2018;drc=43c99a312a3fa5736d6eca4db63908c08ddafff3<!----></a><br><br>    contents_data_.insert(contents_data_.begin() + to_position,<span class="line"><!---->    contents_data_.insert(contents_data_.begin() + to_position,<!----></span><br>                            std::move(moved_data));<span class="line"><!---->                            std::move(moved_data));<!----></span><br><br>as there is no check if `to_position` is out of bounds of `contents_data_`.<span class="line"><!---->as there is no check if `to_position` is out of bounds of `contents_data_`.<!----></span><br><br><br>---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br><br>The fix would be to constrain `to_index` in `TabStripModel::MoveGroupTo`<span class="line"><!---->The fix would be to constrain `to_index` in `TabStripModel::MoveGroupTo`<!----></span><br>and add a CHECK in `TabStripModel::MoveWebContentsAtImpl` to crash in case it's called with an invalid index.<span class="line"><!---->and add a CHECK in `TabStripModel::MoveWebContentsAtImpl` to crash in case it's called with an invalid index.<!----></span><br><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=671;drc=0e45c020c43b1a9f6d2870ff7f92b30a2f03a458<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=671;drc=0e45c020c43b1a9f6d2870ff7f92b30a2f03a458"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=671;drc=0e45c020c43b1a9f6d2870ff7f92b30a2f03a458<!----></a><br><br>to_index = ConstrainMoveIndex(to_index, false);<span class="line"><!---->to_index = ConstrainMoveIndex(to_index, false);<!----></span><br><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2013;drc=43c99a312a3fa5736d6eca4db63908c08ddafff3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2013;drc=43c99a312a3fa5736d6eca4db63908c08ddafff3"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2013;drc=43c99a312a3fa5736d6eca4db63908c08ddafff3<!----></a><br><br>CHECK_LT(index, static_cast<int>(contents_data_.size()));<span class="line"><!---->CHECK_LT(index, static_cast&lt;int&gt;(contents_data_.size()));<!----></span><br>CHECK_LT(to_position, static_cast<int>(contents_data_.size()));<span class="line"><!---->CHECK_LT(to_position, static_cast&lt;int&gt;(contents_data_.size()));<!----></span><br>// or<span class="line"><!---->// or<!----></span><br>CHECK(ContainsIndex(index));<span class="line"><!---->CHECK(ContainsIndex(index));<!----></span><br>CHECK(ContainsIndex(to_position));<span         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         Not requesting merge to dev (M99) because latest trunk commit (958882) appears to be prior to dev branch point (961656).         Hello, Thomas. Thanks for reaching out about this and following up with an email request. Apologies for the delay as we worked through our bug reward decisions. <span class="line"><!---->Hello, Thomas. Thanks for reaching out about this and following up with an email request. Apologies for the delay as we worked through our bug reward decisions. <!----></span><br>The other issue you linked as an example (<span class="line"><!---->The other issue you linked as an example (<!----></span>issue 1239057<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1239057" title="Security: UaF in TabStripModel::MoveWebContentsAtImpl"><!---->issue 1239057<!----></a>) was discovered and reported mid last year, and was relatively early on during very recent trend of reports away from issues triggered by remote content to issues that were strongly or solely dependent on user interaction. While these issues are important as well and can be exploited by a convincing attacker and a convinced user, they aren't as strongly exploitable and impactful as the bug reports that demonstrate exploitability with report content or the most limited. We have started to adjust reward amounts accordingly and have updated our VRP reward rules and guidelines [1] recently to reflect that. <span class="line"><!---->) was discovered and reported mid last year, and was relatively early on during very recent trend of reports away from issues triggered by remote content to issues that were strongly or solely dependent on user interaction. While these issues are important as well and can be exploited by a convincing attacker and a convinced user, they aren't as strongly exploitable and impactful as the bug reports that demonstrate exploitability with report content or the most limited. We have started to adjust reward amounts accordingly and have updated our VRP reward rules and guidelines [1] recently to reflect that. <!----></span><br><br>Based on this and while we appreciate your efforts and reporting this issue to us, the VRP Panel has decided that the original reward amount is sufficient for this report. <span class="line"><!---->Based on this and while we appreciate your efforts and reporting this issue to us, the VRP Panel has decided that the original reward amount is sufficient for this report. <!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/5745167867576320<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/5745167867576320"><!---->https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/5745167867576320<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>With the Touch UI layout, dragging a tab group after a tab that has just closed causes a heap-buffer-overflow.<span class="line"><!---->With the Touch UI layout, dragging a tab group after a tab that has just closed causes a heap-buffer-overflow.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 99.0.4774.0<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 99.0.4774.0<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. chrome --top-chrome-touch-ui=enabled<span class="line"><!---->1. chrome --top-chrome-touch-ui=enabled<!----></span><br>2. Add the NTP to a new tab group<span class="line"><!---->2. Add the NTP to a new tab group<!----></span><br>3. Open poc.html in a new tab<span class="line"><!---->3. Open poc.html in a new tab<!----></span><br>4. Drag the tab group to the right of poc.html<span class="line"><!---->4. Drag the tab group to the right of poc.html<!----></span><br><br>FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->FOR CRASHES, PLEASE INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ADDITIONAL INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Type of crash: browser<span class="line"><!---->Type of crash: browser<!----></span><br>Crash State:<span class="line"><!---->Crash State:<!----></span><br>=================================================================<span class="line"><!---->=================================================================<!----></span><br>==15532==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: heap-buffer-overflow on address 0x127bf1b11f18 at pc 0x7ffbbad33ac5 bp 0x00bc837fde60 sp 0x00bc837fdea8<span class="line"><!---->==15532==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: heap-buffer-overflow on address 0x127bf1b11f18 at pc 0x7ffbbad33ac5 bp 0x00bc837fde60 sp 0x00bc837fdea8<!----></span><br>READ of size 8 at 0x127bf1b11f18 thread T0<span class="line"><!---->READ of size 8 at 0x127bf1b11f18 thread T0<!----></span><br>==15532==WARNING: Failed to use and restart external symbolizer!<span class="line"><!---->==15532==WARNING: Failed to use and restart external symbolizer!<!----></span><br>    #0 0x7ffbbad33ac4 in >,std::__1::allocator<std::__1::unique_ptr<TabStripModel::WebContentsData,std::__1::default_delete<TabStripModel::WebContentsData> > > >::__move_range C:\b\s\w\ir\cache\builder\src\buildtools\third_party\libc++\trunk\include\vector:1763<span class="line"><!---->    #0 0x7ffbbad33ac4 in C:\b\s\w\ir\cache\builder\src\buildtools\third_party\libc++\trunk\include\vector:1763<!----></span><br>    #1 0x7ffbbad2dc11 in         The heap buffer overflow happens at<span class="line"><!---->The heap buffer overflow happens at<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2018;drc=43c99a312a3fa5736d6eca4db63908c08ddafff3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2018;drc=43c99a312a3fa5736d6eca4db63908c08ddafff3"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2018;drc=43c99a312a3fa5736d6eca4db63908c08ddafff3<!----></a><br><br>    contents_data_.insert(contents_data_.begin() + to_position,<span class="line"><!---->    contents_data_.insert(contents_data_.begin() + to_position,<!----></span><br>                            std::move(moved_data));<span class="line"><!---->                            std::move(moved_data));<!----></span><br><br>as there is no check if `to_position` is out of bounds of `contents_data_`.<span class="line"><!---->as there is no check if `to_position` is out of bounds of `contents_data_`.<!----></span><br><br><br>---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br><br>The fix would be to constrain `to_index` in `TabStripModel::MoveGroupTo`<span class="line"><!---->The fix would be to constrain `to_index` in `TabStripModel::MoveGroupTo`<!----></span><br>and add a CHECK in `TabStripModel::MoveWebContentsAtImpl` to crash in case it's called with an invalid index.<span class="line"><!---->and add a CHECK in `TabStripModel::MoveWebContentsAtImpl` to crash in case it's called with an invalid index.<!----></span><br><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=671;drc=0e45c020c43b1a9f6d2870ff7f92b30a2f03a458<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=671;drc=0e45c020c43b1a9f6d2870ff7f92b30a2f03a458"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=671;drc=0e45c020c43b1a9f6d2870ff7f92b30a2f03a458<!----></a><br><br>to_index = ConstrainMoveIndex(to_index, false);<span class="line"><!---->to_index = ConstrainMoveIndex(to_index, false);<!----></span><br><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2013;drc=43c99a312a3fa5736d6eca4db63908c08ddafff3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2013;drc=43c99a312a3fa5736d6eca4db63908c08ddafff3"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2013;drc=43c99a312a3fa5736d6eca4db63908c08ddafff3<!----></a><br><br>CHECK_LT(index, static_cast<int>(contents_data_.size()));<span class="line"><!---->CHECK_LT(index, static_cast&lt;int&gt;(contents_data_.size()));<!----></span><br>CHECK_LT(to_position, static_cast<int>(contents_data_.size()));<span class="line"><!---->CHECK_LT(to_position, static_cast&lt;int&gt;(contents_data_.size()));<!----></span><br>// or<span class="line"><!---->// or<!----></span><br>CHECK(ContainsIndex(index));<span class="line"><!---->CHECK(ContainsIndex(index));<!----></span><br>CHECK(ContainsIndex(to_position));<span         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         Hello, Thomas. Thanks for reaching out about this and following up with an email request. Apologies for the delay as we worked through our bug reward decisions. <span class="line"><!---->Hello, Thomas. Thanks for reaching out about this and following up with an email request. Apologies for the delay as we worked through our bug reward decisions. <!----></span><br>The other issue you linked as an example (<span class="line"><!---->The other issue you linked as an example (<!----></span>issue 1239057<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1239057" title="Security: UaF in TabStripModel::MoveWebContentsAtImpl"><!---->issue 1239057<!----></a>) was discovered and reported mid last year, and was relatively early on during very recent trend of reports away from issues triggered by remote content to issues that were strongly or solely dependent on user interaction. While these issues are important as well and can be exploited by a convincing attacker and a convinced user, they aren't as strongly exploitable and impactful as the bug reports that demonstrate exploitability with report content or the most limited. We have started to adjust reward amounts accordingly and have updated our VRP reward rules and guidelines [1] recently to reflect that. <span class="line"><!---->) was discovered and reported mid last year, and was relatively early on during very recent trend of reports away from issues triggered by remote content to issues that were strongly or solely dependent on user interaction. While these issues are important as well and can be exploited by a convincing attacker and a convinced user, they aren't as strongly exploitable and impactful as the bug reports that demonstrate exploitability with report content or the most limited. We have started to adjust reward amounts accordingly and have updated our VRP reward rules and guidelines [1] recently to reflect that. <!----></span><br><br>Based on this and while we appreciate your efforts and reporting this issue to us, the VRP Panel has decided that the original reward amount is sufficient for this report. <span class="line"><!---->Based on this and while we appreciate your efforts and reporting this issue to us, the VRP Panel has decided that the original reward amount is sufficient for this report. <!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/5745167867576320<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/5745167867576320"><!---->https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/5745167867576320<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>With the Touch UI layout, dragging a tab group after a tab that has just closed causes a heap-buffer-overflow.<span class="line"><!---->With the Touch UI layout, dragging a tab group after a tab that has just closed causes a heap-buffer-overflow.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 99.0.4774.0<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 99.0.4774.0<!----></span><br>Operating System: Windows 10<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Windows 10<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. chrome --top-chrome-touch-ui=enabled<span class="line"><!---->1. chrome --top-chrome-touch-ui=enabled<!----></span><br>2. Add the NTP to a new tab group<span class="line"><!---->2. Add the NTP to a new tab group<!----></span><br>3. Open poc.html in a new tab<span class="line"><!---->3. shadow byte represents 8 application bytes):<!----></span><br>  Addressable:           00<span class="line"><!---->  Addressable:           00<!----></span><br>  Partially addressable: 01 02 03 04 05 06 07<span class="line"><!---->  Partially addressable: 01 02 03 04 05 06 07<!----></span><br>  Heap left redzone:       fa<span class="line"><!---->  Heap left redzone:       fa<!----></span><br>  Freed heap region:       fd<span class="line"><!---->  Freed heap region:       fd<!----></span><br>  Stack left redzone:      f1<span class="line"><!---->  Stack left redzone:      f1<!----></span><br>  Stack mid redzone:       f2<span class="line"><!---->  Stack mid redzone:       f2<!----></span><br>  Stack right redzone:     f3<span class="line"><!---->  Stack right redzone:     f3<!----></span><br>  Stack after return:      f5<span class="line"><!---->  Stack after return:      f5<!----></span><br>  Stack use after scope:   f8<span class="line"><!---->  Stack use after scope:   f8<!----></span><br>  Global redzone:          f9<span class="line"><!---->  Global redzone:          f9<!----></span><br>  Global init order:       f6<span class="line"><!---->  Global init order:       f6<!----></span><br>  Poisoned by user:        f7<span class="line"><!---->  Poisoned by user:        f7<!----></span><br>  Container overflow:      fc<span class="line"><!---->  Container overflow:      fc<!----></span><br>  Array cookie:            ac<span class="line"><!---->  Array cookie:            ac<!----></span><br>  Intra object redzone:    bb<span ca<span class="line"><!---->  Left alloca redzone:     ca<!----></span><br>  Right alloca redzone:    cb<span class="line"><!---->  Right alloca redzone:    cb<!----></span><br>==15532==ABORTING<span         This is a serious security regression. If you are not able to fix this quickly, please revert the change that introduced it.<span class="line"><!---->This is a serious security regression. If you are not able to fix this quickly, please revert the change that introduced it.<!----></span><br><br>If this doesn't affect a release branch, or has not been properly classified for severity, please update the Security_Impact or Security_Severity labels, and remove the ReleaseBlock label. To disable this altogether, apply ReleaseBlock-NA.<span class="line"><!---->If this doesn't affect a release branch, or has not been properly classified for severity, please update the Security_Impact or Security_Severity labels, and remove the ReleaseBlock label.         by

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1281078#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Dec 24, 2021, 11:01 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1281078#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Dec 24, 2021, 11:01 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        The heap buffer overflow happens at<span class="line"><!---->The heap buffer overflow happens at<!----></span><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2018;drc=43c99a312a3fa5736d6eca4db63908c08ddafff3<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2018;drc=43c99a312a3fa5736d6eca4db63908c08ddafff3"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2018;drc=43c99a312a3fa5736d6eca4db63908c08ddafff3<!----></a><br><br>    contents_data_.insert(contents_data_.begin() + to_position,<span class="line"><!---->    contents_data_.insert(contents_data_.begin() + to_position,<!----></span><br>                            std::move(moved_data));<span class="line"><!---->                            std::move(moved_data));<!----></span><br><br>as there is no check if `to_position` is out of bounds of `contents_data_`.<span class="line"><!---->as there is no check if `to_position` is out of bounds of `contents_data_`.<!----></span><br><br><br>---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br><br>The fix would be to constrain `to_index` in `TabStripModel::MoveGroupTo`<span class="line"><!---->The fix would be to constrain `to_index` in `TabStripModel::MoveGroupTo`<!----></span><br>and add a CHECK in `TabStripModel::MoveWebContentsAtImpl` to crash in case it's called with an invalid index.<span class="line"><!---->and add a CHECK in `TabStripModel::MoveWebContentsAtImpl` to crash in case it's called with an invalid index.<!----></span><br><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=671;drc=0e45c020c43b1a9f6d2870ff7f92b30a2f03a458<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=671;drc=0e45c020c43b1a9f6d2870ff7f92b30a2f03a458"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=671;drc=0e45c020c43b1a9f6d2870ff7f92b30a2f03a458<!----></a><br><br>to_index = ConstrainMoveIndex(to_index, false);<span class="line"><!---->to_index = ConstrainMoveIndex(to_index, false);<!----></span><br><br><br>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_model.cc;l=2013;drc=43c99a312a3fa5736d6eca4db63908c08ddafff3<a static_cast<int>(contents_data_.size()));<span class="line"><!---->CHECK_LT(index, static_cast&lt;int&gt;(contents_data_.size()));<!----></span><br>CHECK_LT(to_position, static_cast<int>(contents_data_.size()));<span class="line"><!---->CHECK_LT(to_position, static_cast&lt;int&gt;(contents_data_.size()));<!----></span><br>// or<span class="line"><!---->//         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hello, Thomas. Thanks for reaching out about this and following up with an email request. Apologies for the delay as we worked through our bug reward decisions. <span class="line"><!---->Hello, Thomas. Thanks for reaching out about this and following up with an email request. Apologies for the delay as we worked through our bug reward decisions. <!----></span><br>The other issue you linked as an example (<span class="line"><!---->The other issue you linked as an example (<!----></span>issue 1239057<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1239057" title="Security: UaF in TabStripModel::MoveWebContentsAtImpl"><!---->issue 1239057<!----></a>) was discovered and reported mid last year, and was relatively early on during very recent trend of reports away from issues triggered by remote content to issues that were strongly or solely dependent on user interaction. While these issues are important as well and can be exploited by a convincing attacker and a convinced user, they aren't as strongly exploitable and impactful as the bug reports that demonstrate exploitability with report content or the most limited. We have started to adjust reward amounts accordingly and have updated our VRP reward rules and guidelines [1] recently to reflect that. <span class="line"><!---->) was discovered and reported mid last year, and was relatively early on during very recent trend of reports away from issues triggered by remote content to issues that were strongly or solely dependent on user interaction. While these issues are important as well and can be exploited by a convincing attacker and a convinced user, they aren't as strongly exploitable and impactful as the bug reports that demonstrate exploitability with report content or the most limited. We have started to adjust reward amounts accordingly and have updated our VRP reward rules and guidelines [1] recently to reflect that. <!----></span><br><br>Based on this and while we appreciate your efforts and reporting this issue to us, the VRP Panel has decided that the original reward amount is sufficient for this report. <span class="line"><!---->Based on this and while we appreciate your efforts and reporting this issue to us, the VRP Panel has decided that the original reward amount is sufficient for this report. <!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/5745167867576320<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/5745167867576320"><!---->https://bughunters.google.com/about/rules/5745167867576320<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

          <h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

          

          <div class="edit-actions">
            <chops-button class="de-emphasized">
              Cancel
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized">
               issue
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

          position: absolute;

        for LitElement.

window.prpcClient = new AutoRefreshPrpcClient(
 CS_env.token, CS_env.tokenExpiresSec);

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
